title: How to Make a Good Staff Quickly

steps.headline: Find a stout stick about the same height as you .
steps.description: It should be made from wood that isn't bendy or brittle.

steps.headline: Cut it off using some sort of saw or clippers.
Take the stick back to a dry, airy environment and skin it down using a knife of a sander.
Leave it to dry for about a day before skinning it again.
steps.description: A planer is good because it makes the wood smooth but a penknife could be used.

steps.headline: Leave it in a warm, dry place for about a week.
steps.description: To check if it's dry, hit it gently off another piece of wood. It should make a nice crackling sound.

steps.headline: To finish it off, you could engrave your name or something into the wood this can be done using a knife or an engraving tool .
steps.description: You can also stain or paint the staff. If possible, you could laminate it.

text: Find a stout stick about the same height as you . It should be made from wood that isn't bendy or brittle. Cut it off using some sort of saw or clippers.  Take the stick back to a dry, airy environment and skin it down using a knife of a sander.  Leave it to dry for about a day before skinning it again. A planer is good because it makes the wood smooth but a penknife could be used. Leave it in a warm, dry place for about a week. To check if it's dry, hit it gently off another piece of wood. It should make a nice crackling sound. To finish it off, you could engrave your name or something into the wood this can be done using a knife or an engraving tool . You can also stain or paint the staff. If possible, you could laminate it.
